summary:
Jio offers YouTube Premium free for 2 years with JioFiber and AirFiber: Check out plans

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Jio is back with a bumper offer, providing YouTube Premium for free with JioFiber and AirFiber postpaid plans for two years.

  • Users can enjoy an ad-free experience on YouTube.
  • YouTube Premium allows playback in the background and offline downloads.
  • The offer caters to heavy consumers of video content on smartphones and smart TVs.
  • Current pricing for YouTube Premium plans includes monthly rates of ₹89 for students, ₹149 for individuals, and ₹299 for families.
"With this, Jio aims to enhance the experience of Jio’s broadband and postpaid services by offering YouTube Premium which is among the most popular entertainment subscriptions."

This initiative is part of Jio's strategy to provide added value to its broadband services.

title: Neville Noronha to step down as Avenue Supermarts MD-CEO, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to take over - Moneycontrol
summary:
Neville Noronha to step down as Avenue Supermarts MD-CEO, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to take over

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Neville Noronha, CEO of Avenue Supermarts, is set to step down as Managing Director and CEO after a notable tenure. Anshul Asawa from Unilever will take over in March 2025.

  • Neville Noronha has led Avenue Supermarts for over two decades.
  • Anshul Asawa has a 30-year experience at Unilever and has held various leadership roles in Asia and Europe.
  • The transition is aimed to be smooth with Neville supporting Anshul during the changeover.
  • Anshul led digitization efforts and product innovations during his tenure at Unilever.
Neville has chosen not to extend his contract after more than two decades of exceptional leadership.

This leadership change highlights the evolving landscape of retail leadership in India.
newTitle: Neville Noronha to Step Down as Avenue Supermarts MD-CEO

title: Hundreds of excess pilots grounded at Akasa as plane deliveries retard - The Hindu
summary:
Grounding of Excess Pilots at Akasa Air Amid Aircraft Delivery Delays

Published on January 11, 2025, by The Hindu

The global shortage of new aircraft has led to an oversupply of pilots at Akasa Air, causing anxiety among the grounded cockpit crew. With 850 pilots on staff for a fleet of only 26 aircraft, many are waiting long periods to start flying.

  • Akasa Air has 850 pilots, while only 468 are needed based on a standard aircraft-crew ratio.
  • Approximately 400 pilots have not yet flown since being hired, awaiting lengthy training completion.
  • Salary compensation for grounded pilots is significantly lower, creating financial strain.
  • The airline's ambitious growth plans have been disrupted due to delays in Boeing 737 MAX deliveries.
  • The global aircraft delivery issues affect airlines worldwide, leading to operational challenges.
“Despite the changes in the aircraft delivery schedules, more than 60% of our pilots have begun to accumulate flying hours.” - Akasa Air Spokesperson

The situation illustrates the challenges airlines face due to supply chain disruptions and the need for adequate pilot management amidst growth ambitions.
newTitle: Grounding of Excess Pilots at Akasa Air Amid Aircraft Delivery Delays

title: Avenue Supermarts CEO Neville Noronha steps down after 20-year stint at DMart, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to be new chief | Company Business News - Mint
Trade unions condemn L&T CEO’s statement on work hours - The Hindu
summary:
Trade Unions Condemn L&T CEO’s Statement on Work Hours

Date: January 11, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The central trade unions have condemned the statement made by S.N. Subrahmanyan, the chairman and managing director of Larsen & Toubro, suggesting that employees should work 90 hours per week. His words drew backlash from various sectors of society, emphasizing the need for a better work-life balance.

  • Subrahmanyan proposed a drastic increase in work hours to 90 per week, suggesting workers should come to the office even on Sundays.
  • Trade unions likened his remarks to past statements made by corporate leaders advocating for longer working hours.
  • Critics argue that extended hours negatively impact workers' health and social lives, creating a divide between corporate objectives and worker welfare.
  • Many unions highlighted the increasing unemployment rates and warned against policies that prioritize corporate profits over workers' rights.
“Advocating such a policy contradicts the principles of quality of life and human dignity that are fundamental to a progressive society.” - Virjesh Upadhyay, labour studies think tank head

The trade unions' strong response reflects a broader concern over labor rights and the working conditions in India, highlighting the need for a balanced approach to work hours that respects workers' dignity and health.
newTitle: Trade Unions Criticize L&T CEO's Proposal for Extended Work Hours

title: Sebi may revise ₹500 cr derivative exposure limit for institutional investors | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Sebi May Revise ₹500 Cr Derivative Exposure Limit for Institutional Investors

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is contemplating changes to the ₹500-crore exposure limit for institutional investors in derivatives, which was implemented post the COVID-19 outbreak in March 2020. The proposed revisions aim to refine how open interest is measured and link market-wide position limits to actual delivery volumes of stocks.

  • Sebi is considering revising the exposure limit for foreign portfolio investors and mutual funds.
  • The changes address market manipulation risks and excessive volatility in derivatives trading.
  • Current limits include a cumulative cap of ₹7,500 crore on index futures and options trades.
  • Following a study, individual traders reportedly lost ₹1.8 trillion trading index options.
  • The new methodology will focus on a delta-based metric for measuring open interest, aligning with global best practices.
“Moving to a delta-based metric would ensure that we are actually measuring risk the correct way,” - Ananth Narayan, Sebi Whole-Time Member.

The adjustments are set to enhance market stability and better reflect actual trading risks, ensuring investor protection and more informed trading practices.
newTitle: Sebi Considers Revising ₹500 Cr Derivative Exposure Limit for Institutions

title: Neville Noronha quits Avenue Supermarts, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to be new CEO - The Economic Times
summary:
Neville Noronha Quits Avenue Supermarts, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to be New CEO

Publication Date: Today Source: Economic Times

Neville Noronha, CEO of Avenue Supermarts, will not renew his contract ending in January 2026 after leading the company for over two decades. Anshul Asawa from Unilever will take over as CEO Designate from March 2025 and assume full CEO responsibilities in February 2026.

  • Noronha has led Avenue Supermarts for over 20 years.
  • Anshul Asawa is the new CEO Designate, starting March 15, 2025.
  • Noronha leaves a legacy of significant growth, expanding DMart to over 380 stores.
"A hallmark of Neville's leadership is his conviction that while business strategy is evolved out of a complex metrics of ideas and competing claims, competent execution requires that it is articulated in simple and precise terms."

In conclusion, the transition marks a significant change in leadership for Avenue Supermarts, emphasizing their ongoing growth strategy.
newTitle: Neville Noronha Quits Avenue Supermarts, Unilever's Anshul Asawa to be New CEO

title: 'Love Staring at Wife, She's Wonderful': Anand Mahindra Weighs in 90-Hour Workweek Debate - Republic World
summary:
Anand Mahindra Advocates Quality over Quantity in 90-Hour Workweek Debate

Date: October 2023

Source: Republic World

Anand Mahindra recently addressed the 90-hour workweek debate, emphasizing the necessity to prioritize the quality of work rather than the quantity of hours worked. He shared personal insights and made a case for a balanced approach to work and life, referencing his own commitment to family and personal well-being.

  • Mahindra noted that true productivity is defined by output, not hours logged.
  • He criticized the ongoing debate as being misguided, focusing instead on holistic thinking and personal experiences.
  • Anand Mahindra championed exposure to liberal arts and culture as essential for better decision-making in business.
  • He reflected on the automotive industry, arguing that understanding customer needs requires time spent outside the office.
“What output are you doing even if it's 10 hours? You can change the world in 10 hours.” - Anand Mahindra

In conclusion, Anand Mahindra’s remarks highlight a shift in workplace culture, advocating for balance between work and life, and the value of understanding personal connections in crafting effective business strategies.
newTitle: Anand Mahindra Advocates Quality over Quantity in 90-Hour Workweek Debate

title: DMart Q3 Results: Standalone profit up 6.5% to Rs 785 crore, revenue jumps 17.5% - The Economic Times
summary:
DMart Q3 Results: Standalone profit up 6.5% to Rs 785 crore, revenue jumps 17.5%

Publication Date: Recently Published | Source: ETMarkets.com

Avenue Supermarts reported strong quarterly results with significant revenue growth, although both EBITDA and PAT margins have decreased compared to the previous year.

  • Standalone Q3 revenue increased by 17.5% YoY to Rs 15,565 crore.
  • Profit after tax (PAT) saw a rise of 6.5% YoY to Rs 785 crore.
  • EBITDA margin dropped to 7.9% from 8.5% in Q3FY24.
  • PAT margin decreased to 5% from 5.5% YoY.
  • Same store revenue growth for established stores was 8.3%.
  • DMart Ready experienced a 21.5% growth in demand for home delivery services.
"Our home delivery business now far exceeds our pick-up point sales contribution." - Neville Noronha, MD and CEO

The leadership of Avenue Supermarts is transitioning as CEO Neville Noronha announces he will not renew his term. Anshul Asawa has been appointed as the new CEO effective March 15, 2025.
newTitle: DMart Q3 Financial Results Show Profit Growth Amid Margin Decline

title: DMart Q3 results: Net profit up nearly 5% at Rs 724 crore; Revenue up 17.6% - Moneycontrol
summary:
DMart Q3 results: Net profit up nearly 5% at Rs 724 crore; Revenue up 17.6%

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Avenue Supermarts, which operates the retail chain DMart, reported a 4.9% increase in consolidated net profit for Q3 FY25.

  • Net profit stood at Rs 723.54 crore.
  • Consolidated revenue grew 17.6% to Rs 15,973 crore compared to Rs 13,572 crore in the same quarter last year.
  • EBITDA margin decreased to 7.6% from 8.3% YoY.
  • PAT margin also fell to 5.0% from 5.5% YoY.
“Our consolidated revenue grew 17.6 percent at Rs 15,973 cr vs Rs 13,572 in the corresponding quarter.”

The growth in revenue indicates strong consumer demand and effective business strategies, despite a decrease in margins.
newTitle: DMart Reports Q3 Earnings: Net Profit Increases by Nearly 5% Amid Revenue Growth

title: DMart Q3 Results: Avenue Supermarts net profit rises 4.7% to ₹723 crore, revenue up 17.6% YoY | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
DMart Q3 Results: Avenue Supermarts net profit rises 4.7% to ₹723 crore, revenue up 17.6% YoY

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Avenue Supermarts, the operator of DMart, reported its Q3FY25 results, showing a 4.79% increase in consolidated net profit and a significant growth in revenue year over year.

  • Net profit reached ₹723.72 crore, up from ₹690.61 crore in Q3FY24.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 17.68% to ₹15,972.55 crore.
  • Total income, including other income, rose 17.57% to ₹15,996.69 crore.
  • EBITDA increased by 8.7% to ₹1,217.3 crore, with an EBITDA margin of 7.6%.
  • Basic Earnings per Share (EPS) rose to ₹11.12.
  • Avenue Supermarts plans to adapt its home delivery services in response to increasing demand.
  • CEO Neville Noronha announced his departure after 20 years, with Anshul Asawa appointed as CEO Designate.
  • DMart opened 10 new stores in the December quarter, reaching a total of 387 stores.
“After more than two decades of exceptional leadership... Neville has chosen not to extend his contract.” - Avenue Supermarts

This quarter's results indicate continuous growth for DMart, along with innovative adjustments to meet market demands.
newTitle: DMart Q3 Results: Avenue Supermarts Reports 4.7% Net Profit Increase

title: 'I love staring at my wife': Anand Mahindra takes a swipe at L&T chairman’s 90-hour workweek call - Hindustan Times
summary:
Anand Mahindra Responds to L&T Chairman's 90-Hour Workweek Suggestion

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Industrialist Anand Mahindra offered insights on balancing his work and personal life while responding to L&T Chairman's controversial suggestion of a 90-hour workweek.

  • Mahindra expressed his affection for his wife, stating he enjoys spending time at home, contrasting with the L&T chairman's remarks.
  • He emphasized the importance of quality over quantity in terms of work hours.
  • Mahindra highlighted that social media provides him feedback from a vast audience of 11 million.
  • The discussion was prompted by comments from L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan about work-life balance and leisure time.
  • L&T clarified that the Chairman's comments reflect a commitment to national progress and infrastructure development.
“I am on social media because it is an amazing business tool. On one platform, I get feedback from 11 million people.” - Anand Mahindra

In conclusion, Mahindra's statements underscore the value of personal time and quality work-life balance amid growing workplace demands.
newTitle: Anand Mahindra Responds to 90-Hour Workweek Suggestion

title: #e4mBreaking: HT Media appoints TikTok’s Sameer Singh as Group CEO - Exchange4Media
ITC Hotels Allots 125.11 Crore Shares to ITC Shareholders, Ceases To Be A Subsidiary - NDTV Profit
summary:
ITC Hotels Allocates 125.11 Crore Shares to ITC Shareholders, Ceases To Be A Subsidiary

Date: 11 Jan 2025
Source: NDTV Profit

ITC Hotels Ltd. allotted 125.11 crore equity shares to its shareholders during a Board meeting on January 11, 2025, as part of a restructuring effort following a Scheme of Arrangement between ITC Ltd. and ITCHL.

  • Shares were allocated to shareholders of ITC Ltd. as of January 6, 2025.
  • The move aims to demerge and reorganize both ITC Ltd. and ITC Hotels.
  • ITC Hotels will no longer be a subsidiary of ITC Limited starting January 11, 2025.
  • ITC Hotels plans to list the newly allotted shares, which will remain frozen until permissions are obtained.
  • This demerger aligns with ITC's strategy to segregate its hotels business, with ITC Hotels anticipated to become India's second-largest hotel chain.
"The demerger has been structured as part of ITC's strategy to separate its hotels business."

This significant restructuring allows ITC Hotels to establish itself independently, highlighting ITC Ltd.'s strategic initiative to enhance its operational focus within the hospitality sector.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Allocates 125.11 Crore Shares, Ends Subsidiary Status

title: Priyanka Gandhi demands answers from PM Narendra Modi over falling value of rupee, reminds of his attacks on UPA - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi demands answers from PM Narendra Modi over falling value of rupee, reminds of his attacks on UPA

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized the current government for the rupee reaching its lowest value against the US dollar, demanding accountability from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

  • The rupee declined 18 paise to settle at 86.04 against the US dollar.
  • Priyanka recalled PM Modi's past statements during UPA's tenure linking rupee value with government prestige.
  • She emphasized that Modi should explain the current situation to the public.
  • Contributing factors include global crude oil prices and foreign funds outflow.
"Today he himself is the prime minister and all the records on the fall of the rupee have been broken. He should answer to the people of the country," Priyanka Gandhi stated.

This situation emphasizes the need for the government to respond effectively to economic challenges amidst changing global dynamics.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Criticizes PM Modi Over Rupee's Decline

title: Laxmi Dental IPO: OrbiMed-backed ₹698-crore IPO mobilises ₹314 crore from anchor investors ahead of subscription | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Laxmi Dental IPO: OrbiMed-backed ₹698-crore IPO mobilises ₹314 crore from anchor investors ahead of subscription

Date & Source: January 2023, Live Mint

OrbiMed-backed Laxmi Dental has raised ₹314 crore from anchor investors prior to its initial public offering (IPO) which opens for subscription on January 13.

The initial share sale will conclude on January 15, with shares priced between ₹407-428.

  • Laxmi Dental allocated 73.39 lakh shares to 31 entities at ₹428 each.
  • The IPO includes a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹138 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) worth ₹560 crore.
  • The company's shares will be listed on the BSE and NSE.
  • Proceeds from the fresh issue will be used to repay debt, fund capital expenditures, and invest in its subsidiary.
“Laxmi Dental is an end-to-end integrated dental products company with a comprehensive portfolio.”

The Laxmi Dental IPO is significant as it taps into the growing demand for dental products and is backed by strong investor interest from various entities.
newTitle: Laxmi Dental IPO Collects ₹314 Crore from Anchor Investors

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Allotment Highlights: Check GMP, listing, and key details - The Financial Express
summary:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO Allotment Status Highlights

Date & Source: January 10, 2025 - Financial Express

Quadrant Future Tek's IPO, with a total worth of Rs 290 crores, was opened for bidding from January 7 to January 9. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of 1 crore equity shares priced between Rs 275 to Rs 290 each, with Sundae Capital Advisors as the book-running manager. The allotment is set to be finalized today, with the company’s listing on BSE and NSE scheduled for January 14.

  • The company has a market capitalization of ₹1160.00 crore.
  • Key performance indicators include an ROE of 33.41% and a Debt-to-Equity ratio of 1.86.
  • The latest GMP for the IPO is Rs 152, indicating an estimated listing price of Rs 442.
  • Subscription details reveal an overwhelming response, with the issue subscribed 195.96 times overall.
Gaurav Garg, Research Analyst: “The Indian Specialty Cable and Train Control System market is expected to witness significant growth.”

This new IPO is poised to make a substantial impact in the rail industry, enhancing safety features with innovative technology.
newTitle: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Allotment Highlights: Check GMP, Listing, and Key Details

title: No more actions on derivatives on anvil: Sebi's Ananth Narayan - Moneycontrol
summary:
No More Actions on Derivatives: Insights from Sebi's Ananth Narayan

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is not planning any additional restrictions on derivatives, according to Sebi's Wholetime Member Ananth Narayan. Sebi is focusing on improving the system without further constraints.

  • Sebi assures that no further actions will be taken against derivatives trading.
  • An expert group is working on measures to enhance business practices and risk management in the derivatives market.
  • Recent restrictions imposed in November aimed at curbing speculative trades after poor performance data for retail investors.
  • Discussions within Sebi include measures to improve risk assessment in the derivatives market.
“At this point in time, there is no thought of Sebi taking any further steps in this particular regard.” - Ananth Narayan

This stance demonstrates Sebi's commitment to maintain the integrity and trust of the derivatives market while exploring avenues for enhancements.
newTitle: No More Actions on Derivatives: Insights from Sebi's Ananth Narayan

title: Foxconn halts Chinese workers' deployment to India, sends Taiwanese staff - Business Standard
summary:
Foxconn Halts Chinese Workers' Deployment to India and Sends Taiwanese Staff

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Rest of World

Foxconn, a major partner for Apple, has ceased sending Chinese workers to its Indian factories and is replacing them with Taiwanese workers amid critical equipment shipment delays.

  • Foxconn's shift threatens Apple's production strategy in India.
  • Delays in the shipment of vital manufacturing equipment may hinder Apple's plans to diversify production away from China.
  • Chinese workers were asked to cancel travel to India, leading to a scramble for replacements.
  • Geopolitical tensions between China and India may be influencing this decision.
“Currently, the equipment and manpower are not allowed to go over [to India],” a source told Rest of World.

The situation highlights the challenges Apple faces in its manufacturing shift to India and underscores the complexities of global supply chains.
newTitle: Foxconn Halts Chinese Workers' Deployment to India and Sends Taiwanese Staff

title: IREDA, PFC, REC: How to trade 3 PSU power stocks in market crash? - ET Now
summary:
IREDA, PFC, REC: How to trade 3 PSU power stocks in market crash?

Updated: Jan 11, 2025 16:02 IST

The PSU power stocks have suffered a significant decline due to recent market sell-offs, with many losing over 30% from their peak values.

  • The BSE Power index dropped by 27% from its peak.
  • REC shares fell 29%, closing at Rs 459.65.
  • PFC shares dropped 30%, closing at Rs 404.20.
  • IREDA shares lost 35%, closing at Rs 201.15.
“The rally in IREDA shares couldn't sustain due to profit booking. I would recommend to exit,” said Jatin Gedia, Technical Research Analyst at Mirae Asset Sharekhan.

IREDA's shares are up more than 500% from its IPO price of Rs 32 launched in November 2024, while REC and PFC shares have shown modest performances.

Recommendation: Investors are advised to exit their positions or hold for the long term in PFC and REC.
newTitle: How to Trade IREDA, PFC, and REC Stocks Amid Market Crash
